sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <record_update table="x_sthc_testing_sui_test_step"> <x_sthc_testing_sui_test_step action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <applicaiton>OpTime</applicaiton> <assignment_group/> <detailed_description/> <expected_result/> <number>TS0001927</number> <order>62</order> <prep_step>false</prep_step> <state>draft</state> <sys_created_by>RBUSCH</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2018-07-19 20:52:47</sys_created_on> <sys_id>5a5c9d5fdb9f5b0040f8fcfa0c96194e</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>RBUSCH</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2018-07-19 20:52:47</sys_updated_on> <test>Go Manage Orders, open "Endoscopy - Pre-Procedure/Intra-Procedure" order set. Place order for NPO diet, Vital Signs per unit routine, Informed Consent for esophagogastroduodenoscopy with possible biopsy and conscious sedation, LR infusion, CBC, & ampicillin 500mg for gastrointestinal infection with the first dose starting now, Versed 2 mg/mL IV & fentanyl 25 mcg IV. Click Sign Orders. Confirm orders all have a phase of care of Pre-Procedure (GI), except for the versed and fentanyl order which should have a phase of care of Procedure (GI). Orders should be marked as Verbal with readback with Surgery, Ambulatory Physician as the ordering provider.-Pre-op Orders are placed</test> <test_script display_value="TES0001004">1ebb155fdb9f5b0040f8fcfa0c9619bf</test_script> <testing_user>SURAMBMD</testing_user> </x_sthc_testing_sui_test_step> </record_update>
